A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I would say I liked The Last Jedi (TLJ) better than The Force Awakens (TFA)\, but then I realised it is actually more like saying I disliked TLJ less than TFA. As usual some plot lines still maintain the Original Trilogy mirroring. But director Rian Johnson is really doing a lot his own things here and taking bold and controversial turns\, even to disregarding JJ Abrams' take with TFA which I already had bones to pick. I really don't know where they are taking this sequel trilogy as there doesn't seem to be any story arc or road map ahead. Well at least I really enjoyed the opening battle sequence\, that felt like Star Wars.
